metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33193 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A crafted method sent through HTTP/2 will bypass validation and be forwarded by mod_proxy, which can lead to request splitting or cache poisoning. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.17 to 2.4.48.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33193` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
apache2-bin - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
apache2-data - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
apache2-utils - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> commits for trunk and 2.4 don't match, needs investigation commit for 2.4 is the one listed in the vulnerability report as of 2021-08-26, no new version of apache contains the fix

criterions.comment: apache2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.41-4ubuntu3.5').
